source.title: An integrative theory of locus coeruleus-norepinephrine function: adaptive gain and optimal performance

confidence_rationale: Strong evidence for separable tonic and phasic noradrenergic modes with distinct control effects, directly supporting REE tonic/phasic axis decomposition and volatility/readiness separation.

mapping.source_claim_statement: LC-NE function exhibits distinct tonic and phasic operating modes that modulate task engagement, exploration, and performance.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports REE control-plane design where axes include explicit tonic/phasic components and separate arousal baseline from volatility/interrupt dynamics.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Covers one axis family in depth (LC-NE), not full multi-axis REE control-plane completion.
mapping.source_context: Systems/cognitive neuroscience theory with broad empirical grounding.

confidence_components.notes: Direct support for tonic/phasic split and mode-dependent control effects.
